conclusion: The problem asks for the work done by the gas on the surroundings when transitioning from state D to state A in the ABCDA cycle.
The work done by the gas during a process is given by the area under the p-V diagram for that process.
The ABCDA cycle is shown on a p-V diagram with states A, B, C, and D connected in a rectangular cycle. The pressures are P1 and P2, and the volumes are V1 and V2.
The AD segment is an isobaric process (constant pressure).
The work done during the AD segment is W_AD = P1 (V2 - V1).
The DB segment is an isochoric process (constant volume).
The work done during the DB segment is W_DB = 0 because there is no change in volume.
The BC segment is an isobaric process (constant pressure).
The work done during the BC segment is W_BC = P2 (V2 - V1).
The CA segment is an isochoric process (constant volume).
The work done during the CA segment is W_CA = 0 because there is no change in volume.
The total work done by the gas during the entire cycle is W_total = W_AD + W_DB + W_BC + W_CA = P1 (V2 - V1) + 0 + P2 (V2 - V1) + 0 = (P1 + P2) (V2 - V1).
The work done by the gas when transitioning from state D to state A is the work done during the AD segment, which is W_DA = -W_AD.
The work done by the gas on the surroundings when transitioning from state D to state A is W_DA = -P1 (V2 - V1).
